Suspects Sought In ATM Burglary At OC Weinerschnitzel
November 28, 2011 2:33 PM Share this View Comments More Activity Facebook Activity What's this? Add to Timeline - What's This Click "Add to Timeline" to publish what you read to Facebook See what your friends have read on CBS Local sites Use "Remove" or "Turn off" to disable at any time (courtesy Anaheim Police Dept.)
Filed under Local , News , Syndicated Local Related tags Anaheim , Police , Robbery , Suspects , Weinerschnitzel Top Features CBSLA iPhone App Follow Us On Twitter SANTA ANA (CBS) — Police on Monday sought the public’s help in finding two suspects in a burglary at an Anaheim fast food restaurant.
On November 22, 2011, at approximately 2:15 in the morning, two suspects broke into a Wienerschnitzel store located in the 2800 block of West La Palma Avenue.
An initial investigation suggested the suspects — who may have entered the restaurant through the drive-thru window — were inside the location long enough to remove the ATM machine using a pallet jack. Upon gaining entry, the suspects covered the surveillance cameras with napkins from inside the business.
Sometime during the burglary, a napkin fell from one of the surveillance cameras. As the suspect replaced the napkin, the camera was able to snap a close-up image.
The photographed suspect is described as a black male, 5’7″, medium build with black hair and mustache. He is seen wearing all-black clothing including gloves and a Dickies baseball cap.
The second suspect is described as a black male, also 5’7″, medium build, all-black clothing and gloves.
Anyone with information about this burglary or the identity of the suspects is asked to call Detective Chris Cooper at (714) 765-1185.
